root_causes: No SPSS code provided to evaluate logical equivalence
instructions: Provide the EXPECTED_LOGIC_PER_QUESTION entry for each Question ID: include precise validation rules, derived/computed variable definitions, skip/branching conditions, allowed ranges, and any 'hidden' or 'disabled' flags.
Provide the corresponding TRANSFORMER_OUTPUT_PER_QUESTION SPSS code for each Question ID so the reviewer can compare actual implementation against expected logic.

If any question involves a computed/derived variable, explicitly indicate 'derived' and the exact formula (e.g., 'sum of Q1..Q5 if none missing; otherwise system-missing') so the transformer is required to emit matching COMPUTE/IF/NMISS logic.
Regenerate only the questions that fail the logic check once the EXPECTED_LOGIC and TRANSFORMER_OUTPUT are supplied.

training_example_patch.title: Derived variable 'total_score' from item responses with missing-data rule
training_example_patch.example:
EXPECTED_LOGIC: Q_total = sum(Q1..Q5) when NMISS(Q1..Q5)=0; else Q_total = SYSMIS. TRANSFORMER_OUTPUT (correct SPSS): COMPUTE Q_total = SUM(Q1,Q2,Q3,Q4,Q5).
IF (NMISS(Q1,Q2,Q3,Q4,Q5) > 0) Q_total = $SYSMIS.
EXECUTE.
training_example_patch.why_needed: Demonstrates how a derived variable with an explicit missing-data rule should be represented in SPSS code, so the transformer learns to generate COMPUTE plus conditional NMISS handling for derived variables rather than treating them as regular validated survey questions.
